[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Swift XRT software defines requirements for managing X-ray telescope operations, ensuring reliable control, telemetry processing, and fault recovery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Swift XRT software provides telescope control, data acquisition, telemetry processing, and automated fault recovery, integrating with spacecraft systems and ground control.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Swift XRT integrates with spacecraft telemetry systems, payload control, and mission planning tools for seamless command execution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Swift XRT provides operator access via ground control terminals and web-based mission management tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Swift XRT interacts with spacecraft hardware for image capture, data processing, and system diagnostics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Swift XRT supports RTOS and secure data transfer protocols for mission-critical operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Swift XRT transmits commands and telemetry using encrypted communication channels.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Swift XRT optimizes storage for telemetry logs and high-resolution images.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Swift XRT ensures nearly always uptime with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Swift XRT is configurable for different mission profiles.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Swift XRT integrates with external telemetry and data analysis services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Swift XRT manages telescope control, telemetry processing, and fault-tolerant recovery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for mission operators, spacecraft engineers, and researchers familiar with space observatories.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Swift XRT depends on stable telemetry links, ground stations, and compliant spacecraft subsystems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Swift XRT assumes spacecraft subsystems are functional and comply with mission control protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The software shall interface with spacecraft telemetry systems for data acquisition (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The software shall support encrypted command and control transmissions (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The software shall integrate with ground control systems to enable real-time command execution (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The software shall process telemetry data in real time, supporting fault detection mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The software shall execute telescope alignment commands accurately (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The software shall process error logs to identify and resolve system faults (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The software shall provide an intuitive interface for mission operators.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The software shall handle up to many thousands telemetry messages per second (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall store telemetry and image data for analysis and support data retrieval and redundancy.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system architecture shall follow modular design principles for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The software shall comply with spacecraft mission guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The software shall dynamically scale to handle increasing telemetry data loads, maintain comprehensive event logs for analysis, and support seamless integration with additional payloads.
